conclusion: To determine the magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the entire wire frame, we need to analyze the forces acting on each segment of the wire frame due to the magnetic field.
The wire frame consists of a straight segment MN and a semi-circular segment MQN. The magnetic field is uniform and perpendicular to the plane of the wire frame.

premise: The force on the straight segment MN due to the magnetic field is given by F.
conclusion: Ampere Force on the Straight Segment MN is F.

premise: The semi-circular wire MQN experiences a force due to the magnetic field.
conclusion: The semi-circular wire generates a force that acts radially inward, but the resultant force due to the symmetry of the semi-circle will cancel out as the forces on opposite sides of the center cancel each other out.

premise: The force on the straight segment MN is F. The semi-circular segment MQN does not contribute to the net force due to symmetry (forces cancel out).
conclusion: Therefore, the magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the entire wire frame is only due to the straight segment MN.

premise: The magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the entire wire frame is only due to the straight segment MN.
conclusion: The magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the entire wire frame is F.
